definition: Zhao Kuangyin, personal name of founding Song emperor Song Taizu 宋太祖 (927-976)
to surpass (old)
surname Zhao/one of the seven states during the Warring States Period (476-220 BC)/the Former Zhao 前趙 (304-329) and Later Zhao 後趙 (319-350), states of the Sixteen Kingdoms
surname Kuang
to rectify
descendant/heir/offspring/posterity/to inherit

sentences.english: Although he was a military general, he was fond of reading.
sentences.chinese: 赵匡胤虽是一员武将，却很喜爱读书，常手不释卷。

sentences.english: After the death of Zhao Kuangyin, his brother ascends the throne.
sentences.chinese: 赵匡胤死后，赵光义即位。

sentences.english: Zhao Kuangyin, accepting the demised throne of the Latter Zhough, founded the Song Dynasty.
sentences.chinese: 赵匡胤接受了后周“禅让”的帝位，建立宋朝。

definition: Emperor Taizu of Song, posthumous title of the founding Song emperor Zhao Kuangyin 趙匡胤|赵匡胤 (927-976), reigned from 960
the military revolt of 960 that led Zhao Kuangyin 趙匡胤|赵匡胤 to found the Song dynasty

Zhu Wen (852-912), military governor 節度使|节度使[jie2 du4 shi3] at the end of Tang, founder of Later Liang of the Five Dynasties (907-923), also known as Emperor Taizu of Later Liang 後梁太祖|后梁太祖[Hou4 Liang2 Tai4 zu3]
Zhu Yuanzhang, personal name of first Ming dynasty emperor Hongwu 洪武[Hong2 wu3]
Zhao Gou, personal name of the tenth Song Emperor Gaozong 高宗[Gao1 zong1]
Li Shimin, personal name of second Tang emperor Taizong 唐太宗[Tang2 Tai4 zong1] (599-649), reigned 626-649
Li Yuan, personal name of first Tang emperor Gaozu 唐高祖[Tang2 Gao1 zu3] (566-635), reigned 618-626
lit. to take the yellow gown (idiom)/fig. to be made emperor/to take the crown
to dismiss military hierarchy using wine cups/cf Song founding Emperor Song Taizu 宋太祖 holds a banquet in 961 and persuades his senior army commanders to go home to their provinces
Zhu Di, personal name of third Ming Emperor Yongle 永樂|永乐[Yong3 le4]
Great Ancestor (posthumous title, e.g. for the founder of a dynasty)
Kou Zhun (961-1023), Northern Song politician and poet
posthumous name given to second emperor of a dynasty/King Taejong of Joseon Korea (1367-1422), reigned 1400-1418
Sima Zhao (211-265), military general and statesman of Cao Wei 曹魏[Cao2 Wei4]
famous Song dynasty family of warriors (c. 10th century AD), resisted the Liao 遼|辽 and defended the Song/the subject of the popular fiction Yang Saga 楊家將|杨家将
emperor/CL:個|个[ge4]
